intro: Ventia lanceolata subsp. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth ventia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, tubular flowers. The subspecies glabrata is distinguished by its smooth, hairless foliage compared to other subspecies. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
